net.gescobar.smppserver
Class SmppServer

java.lang.Object
  net.gescobar.smppserver.SmppServer

public class SmppServer
extends Object

An SMPP Server that accepts client connections and process SMPP packets. Every time a connection is accepted, a new SmppSession object is created to handle the packets from that connection. It is only destroyed when the client disconnects.

Starting the SMPP Server is as simple as instantiating this class and calling the start() method:

        SmppServer server = new SmppServer();
        server.start();
        ...
 
  // somewhere else
  server.stop();

To process the SMPP packets you will need to provide an implementation of the PacketProcessor interface using the constructor SmppServer(int, PacketProcessor) or the setter setPacketProcessor(PacketProcessor). If no PacketProcessor is specified, a default implementation that always returns 0 (ESME_ROK in the SMPP specification) is used.

Author:
German Escobar

Constructor Detail

SmppServer

public SmppServer(int port)
Constructor. Creates an instance with the specified port and default PacketProcessor and SequenceNumberScheme implementations.

Parameters:
port - the server will accept connections in this port.

SmppServer

public SmppServer(int port,
                  PacketProcessor packetProcessor)
Constructor. Creates an instance with the specified port and PacketProcessor implementation. A default SequenceNumberScheme implementation is used.

Parameters:
port - the server will accept connections in this port.
packetProcessor - the PacketProcessor implementation that will process the SMPP messages.

Starts listening to client connections through the specified port.

Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs when opening the socket.

setPacketProcessor

public void setPacketProcessor(PacketProcessor packetProcessor)
Sets the packet processor that will be used for new sessions. Old sessions will not be affected.

Parameters:
packetProcessor - the PacketProcessor implementation to be used.
